claim_text: Global copper demand outlook indicates material tightening through 2040
source_title: Copper in the Age of AI Challenges of Electrification
extract_or_paraphrase: Outlook trajectory cited in the report shows global demand increasing from 28 Mt in 2025 to 42 Mt in 2040.
confidence_rationale: Quantitative anchor is explicit and page-anchored but based on a proprietary scenario outlook
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 9; used in Executive Summary and T1 sections

claim_text: Base-case global copper demand reaches 42.7 Mtpa by 2035
source_title: High-wire Act Is Soaring Copper Demand an Obstacle to Future Growth
extract_or_paraphrase: Base-case forecast value of 42.7 Mtpa by 2035 is retained as a comparator demand trajectory.
confidence_rationale: Forecast claim is explicit and page-anchored but model assumptions are vendor-specific
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 3; companion to E-001

claim_text: Australian data-centre electricity demand is projected to rise strongly from FY25 to FY50
source_title: Australia Data Centre Energy Consumption Report
extract_or_paraphrase: Trajectory used in the report is 3.9 TWh (FY25), 12.0 TWh (FY30), and 34.5 TWh (FY50).
confidence_rationale: Primary Australia-focused demand signal with clear numeric path and direct page anchor
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 4; demand-pull framing for T1

claim_text: Australian copper export value outlook rises from A$12.565b to A$17.648b nominal
publisher_or_org: Department of Industry Science and Resources
extract_or_paraphrase: Public baseline in REQ shows nominal export value rise from 2024-25 to 2026-27 forecast.
confidence_rationale: Government primary baseline with explicit numeric values and direct page anchor
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 60; used in Executive Summary and T1.4.2

claim_text: Penalty elements materially affect concentrate value terms and processing operability
source_title: Selective Leaching of Penalty Elements from Copper Concentrates A Review
extract_or_paraphrase: Review evidence indicates penalty-element presence has direct implications for concentrate valuation negotiation and downstream handling.
confidence_rationale: Peer-reviewed review source with direct relevance to impurity and midstream bottleneck claims
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 2; used in H1 and WP-A sections

claim_text: Printed circuit boards can contain high copper concentrations around 20-25 percent
source_title: Towards Resource Regeneration A Focus on Copper Recovery from Electronic Waste
extract_or_paraphrase: PCB copper-content range (20-25%) is used as a quantitative anchor for secondary-feed potential.
confidence_rationale: Peer-reviewed source with specific quantitative composition data and direct page anchor
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 4; used in T2 and WP-B1

claim_text: EU benchmark architecture sets 10 percent extraction 40 percent processing and 25 percent recycling capacities
extract_or_paraphrase: CRMA benchmark percentages are used as architecture comparators rather than direct Australian targets.
confidence_rationale: Legislated primary policy source with explicit benchmark percentages and page anchor
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 3; used in T1.4.4

claim_text: Bioleaching pathway reports an 18 percent global-warming-potential reduction versus comparator route
source_title: Scaling Bioleaching from Lab to Industry A Life Cycle Assessment of Cathode Copper Production
extract_or_paraphrase: LCA result retained as quantitative decarbonisation evidence for alternative copper production route performance.
confidence_rationale: Peer-reviewed result is explicit and anchored but pathway comparability depends on boundary assumptions
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 7; used in Executive Summary and T2.2

claim_text: Electricity-transition assumptions materially influence the reported GWP profile for the bioleaching pathway
source_title: Scaling Bioleaching from Lab to Industry A Life Cycle Assessment of Cathode Copper Production
extract_or_paraphrase: Scenario analysis in the study shows sensitivity of pathway emissions outcomes to electricity system conditions.
confidence_rationale: Directional signal is strong but transferability requires local grid-context harmonization
notes: Appendix A anchor p. 9; used in H2 and WP-B5 framing

claim_text: Co-product-aware refining residue pathways are material to copper value-capture strategy
source_title: Comprehensive Recoveries of Selenium Copper Gold Silver and Lead from a Copper Anode Slime with a Clean and Economical Hydrometallurgical Process
extract_or_paraphrase: Anode-slime recovery evidence is used to support the copper-plus-co-products boundary condition in mission design.
confidence_rationale: Peer-reviewed evidence is technically relevant but extrapolation to broad system strategy needs contextual integration
notes: Appendix A anchor pp. 1 and 5; used in boundary and Mission B framing
